articles.title: Realization of three-point reform proposal called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Realization of three-point reform proposal called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The South Korean catholic priests' council for justice issued a declaration on the situation on Feb. 6 demanding the authorities abolish the "Security Law" and realize the three-point reform proposal including the institution of a law on the human rights committee and a law on combating corruption, Seoul-based MBC reported.
 The organization said that the present situation is facing a precarious crisis and those opposed to the reform are offering their last resistance. It underscored the need to give an impetus to the implementation of the three-point reform proposal.

articles.title: Anti-U.S. NMD signature campaign in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-U.S. NMD signature campaign in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The citizens' network ("peace network") for peace on the Korean peninsula in South Korea announced on Feb. 7 that it is joining the global network, an organization for the peace movement in the United States, in a signature campaign against the U.S. "National Missile Defense" system and "Theatre Missile Defense" system, Seoul-based Yonhap News reported.
 The organization said that many people are taking part in the worldwide signature campaign which has been under way on internet homepage of the global network since Jan. 3

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's work published in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's work published in Peru 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" was brought out in booklet in Peru on Jan. 25.
 The work was published on June 19, Juche 86 (1997).   
 It clarifies that preserving the Juche character and national character in the revolution and construction serves as a fundamental principle to be maintained in carrying out the cause of independence, the socialist cause.

articles.title: Abolition of SL urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of SL urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The chairman  of the Kwangju and south Jolla provincial federation of the south side headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon), members of its headquarters and secretariat and students under the Kwangju and south Jolla provincial federation of university student councils have been on a hunger strike at Chonnam National University, Kwangju, for the last 8 days since Feb. 1, Yonhap News reported.
 They are demanding the abolition of the "Security Law", the release of prisoners of conscience and the legalization of Pomminryon and Hanchongryon (South Korean Federation of University Student Councils).

articles.title: Huge amount of fund allocated for upkeep of U.S. forces in S. Korea
articles.content:
Huge amount of fund allocated for upkeep of U.S. forces in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, February 11 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Krasnaya Zvezda on Jan. 31 said that the United States has annually allocated 14 billion dollars for the upkeep of U.S. forces in South Korea.
 Saying that this was disclosed by a report of the South Korean "Ministry of National Defence", the paper added that the spending for the operation of the military equipment of the 8th U.S. army alone amounts to 1.75 billion dollars and the expenses for the upkeep of the U.S. airforce in South Korea total more than 8 billion dollars.
